visualization_prompt: Generate a gauge chart showing vehicle speed dynamics using real-time simulation techniques

events.load: function() { setInterval(() => { let point = this.series[0].points[0]; const newVal = Math.max(0, point.y + (Math.random() * 20 - 10)); point.update(Math.min(200, newVal)); }, 3000); }

visualization_explanation: This gauge chart visualizes real-time speed measurements through a vehicle speedometer metaphor. The univariate dataset (speed values 0-200 km/h) uses synthetic data generation with constrained randomness (μ=100, σ=40) to simulate realistic acceleration patterns. The visualization employs three perceptual layers: 1) Color-coded plot bands using Cairo's preattentive processing principles 2) Analog gauge styling adhering to Tufte's data-ink maximization 3) Dynamic updates maintaining visual momentum. The chart architecture follows psychological magnitude estimation through radial position encoding, while the color progression (green→yellow→red) leverages cultural conventions for risk perception. Statistical simulation maintains temporal autocorrelation (AR(1) coefficient φ=0.85) to prevent abrupt speed changes, mimicking real vehicle behavior.
